title: Financial Risk Prediction Modeling Using Nonverbal Voice Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Machine Learning Fundamentals, Financial Risk Management Concepts, and Python Programming
context.additional_context: For advanced graduate-level learners, non-real-time learning in a smartphone-based LMS environment, focusing on financial engineering and data science convergence education.

learning_goals: Learners can design a hybrid analysis model combining three or more non-verbal speech characteristics (pitch, tone, speed) and text data (morpheme analysis results) using Python-based libraries (Librosa, TensorFlow, etc.) within one week, and produce a report demonstrating at least 75% accuracy on a test dataset.
Cultivating the ability to implement a two-stage deep learning architecture (Seq2Seq + Attention mechanism) for financial risk prediction
Capable of extracting and quantitatively evaluating risk indicators from S&P 500 corporate earnings call voice data

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
